snippet: The United States is prepared to deploy the aircraft and advisers to help Iraqi forces in their long-running battle to retake the city of Ramadi.
abstract: Pentagon offers to provide attack helicopters and advisers to aid Iraqi forces struggling to expel Islamic State from city of Ramadi; Obama administration weighs risks to American personal and navigates delicate ground between Iraq's Sunnis and Shiites; American officials express frustration at lack of support from Arab and European allies.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER, MATTHEW ROSENBERG and MICHAEL R. GORDON

lead_paragraph: The United States is prepared to deploy the aircraft and advisers to help Iraqi forces in their long-running battle to retake the city of Ramadi.

headline.main: U.S. Is Willing to Use Attack Helicopters to Help Fight ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Willing to Use Attack Helicopters in Iraq to Help Fight ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
